newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX electricity ends mixed after hitting highs.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX electricity ends mixed after hitting highs.

text.p: NYMEX electricity futures ended mixed Thursday after most spot months hit new life-of-contract highs.

Palo Verde (PV) power futures settled mostly lower, backing off the strong gains made through the week, in a move that traders said was partially a correction and partially power chasing easing natural gas futures.
"It was just a bit of a correction but it isn't the beginning of the end (of the recent power futures up trend)," one futures broker said.

December Palo Verde settled down 85 cents at $24.15 after hitting a new contract high of $25.60, while January finished down 21 cents at $22.29 after hitting a new contract high of $23.50 per megawatt hour (MWh).
Remaining PV deferreds settled mostly down between 15 and 35 cents.
December California Oregon Border (COB) closed up 24 cents at $25.50 after hitting a new high of $26.00, while January COB settled up 18 cents at $23.68 after hitting a high of $24.00 per MWh.
Remaining COB deferreds finished mixed, ending between 25 cents lower and 75 cents higher.
NYMEX said an estimated 352 COB and 197 PV contracts traded Thursday.
-- Chris Reese, New York Power Desk 212-859-1627
